Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

I think an option to autoclassify sent e-mails to a subfolder in the "Sent messages" identical to the folder from where the mail was sent would be very useful.

Ex: after receiving an e-mail, I classify it put it in the folder "(My account)/Fol A/Fol B". If I reply to this e-mail, I would like that the sent e-mail is classified in the folder "Sent messages/Fol A/Fol B" instead of in the "Sent messages" trunk folder.

I think this feature is very easy to implement, and avoids having to classify outgoing messages as well.

comments.text:
Hello aceman,

Thank you for the comment, but this option does not what I look for.
This option places the reply in the same folder of the original message. This only contributes to make the inbox folders messy.
What I want is Thunderbird to place the send message in a folder with the same name inside "Sent messages".

If I reply to an e-mail in "(My account)/Fol A/Fol B", I would like that the sent e-mail is classified in the folder "Sent messages/Fol A/Fol B". 

Thus, I can keep track of the sent mails by subject, following the same folder tree structure than for the received messages.

comments.text:
Now I understand. "(My account)/Fol A/Fol B" and "Sent messages/Fol A/Fol B" is not the same folder, you want the folder hierarchy under Sent messages do mirror the "Inbox-type" folders (with received message).
I can confirm the request, but it seems to be a difficult change and probably not many users wish it this way. What means that the TB developers would not have time for it in the foreseeable future. 

Have you looked if there isn't any extension that would do something like that?
https://addons.mozilla.org/thunderbird/

Maybe at least this one could be usable: https://addons.mozilla.org/thunderbird/addon/copy-sent-to-current/
